member.summary: Whether the player has loaded a save and the world has finished initializing.

member.summary: The current stage in the game's loading process.

member.summary: Whether a player save has been loaded.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsSaving
member.summary: Whether the game is currently writing to the save file.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Context.ActiveScreenIds
member.summary: The active split-screen instance IDs.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Context.LastRemovedScreenId
member.summary: The last screen ID that was removed from the game, used to synchronize .

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.LoadStage
member.summary: The current stage in the game's loading process.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsWorldFullyUnloaded
member.summary: Whether the in-game world is completely unloaded and not in the process of being loaded. The world may still exist in memory at this point, but should be ignored.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.HeuristicModsRunningCode
member.summary: If SMAPI is currently waiting for mod code, the mods to which it belongs (with the most recent at the top of the stack).
member.remarks: This is heuristic only. It provides a quick way to identify the most likely mod for deprecation warnings, but it should be followed with a more accurate check if needed.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsGameLaunched
member.summary: Whether the game has performed core initialization. This becomes true right before the first update tick.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsWorldReady
member.summary: Whether the player has loaded a save and the world has finished initializing.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsPlayerFree
member.summary: Whether is true and the player is free to act in the world (no menu is displayed, no cutscene is in progress, etc).

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.CanPlayerMove
member.summary: Whether is true and the player is free to move (e.g. not using a tool).

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsInDrawLoop
member.summary: Whether the game is currently running the draw loop. This isn't relevant to most mods, since you should use events to draw to the screen.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.ScreenId
member.summary: The unique ID of the current screen in split-screen mode. A screen is always assigned a new ID when it's opened (so a player who quits and rejoins has a new screen ID).

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsMultiplayer
member.summary: Whether the game is running in multiplayer or split-screen mode (regardless of whether any other players are connected). See and for more specific checks.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsOnHostComputer
member.summary: Whether this player is running on the main player's computer. This is true for both the main player and split-screen players.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsSplitScreen
member.summary: Whether the current player is playing in a split-screen. This is only applicable when is true, since split-screen players on another computer are just regular remote players.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.HasRemotePlayers
member.summary: Whether there are players connected over the network.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.Context.IsMainPlayer
member.summary: Whether the current player is the main player. This is always true in single-player, and true when hosting in multiplayer.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Context.HasScreenId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get whether a screen ID is still active.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage
member.summary: A low-level stage in the game's loading process.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.None
member.summary: A save is not loaded or loading.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.CreatedBasicInfo
member.summary: The game is creating a new save slot, and has initialized the basic save info.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.CreatedInitialLocations
member.summary: The game is creating a new save slot, and has added the location instances but hasn't fully initialized them yet.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.CreatedLocations
member.summary: The game is creating a new save slot, and has initialized the in-game locations.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.CreatedSaveFile
member.summary: The game is creating a new save slot, and has created the physical save files.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.SaveParsed
member.summary: The game is loading a save slot, and has read the raw save data into . Not applicable when connecting to a multiplayer host. This is equivalent to value 20.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.SaveLoadedBasicInfo
member.summary: The game is loading a save slot, and has applied the basic save info (including player data). Not applicable when connecting to a multiplayer host. Note that some basic info (like daily luck) is not initialized at this point. This is equivalent to value 36.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.SaveAddedLocations
member.summary: The game is loading a save slot and has added the location instances, but hasn't restored their save data yet. Not applicable when connecting to a multiplayer host.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.SaveLoadedLocations
member.summary: The game is loading a save slot, and has restored the in-game location data. Not applicable when connecting to a multiplayer host. This is equivalent to value 50.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.Preloaded
member.summary: The final metadata has been loaded from the save file. This happens before the game applies problem fixes, checks for achievements, starts music, etc. Not applicable when connecting to a multiplayer host.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.Loaded
member.summary: The save is fully loaded, but the world may not be fully initialized yet.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.Ready
member.summary: The save is fully loaded, the world has been initialized, and is now true.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Enums.LoadStage.ReturningToTitle
member.summary: The game is exiting the loaded save and returning to the title screen. This happens before it returns to title; see after it returns.

member.summary: The priority for an asset edit when multiple apply for the same asset.
member.remarks: You can also specify arbitrary intermediate values, like AssetEditPriority.Early + 5.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetEditPriority.Early
member.summary: This edit should be applied before (i.e. 'under') edits.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetEditPriority.Default
member.summary: The default priority.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetEditPriority.Late
member.summary: This edit should be applied after (i.e. 'on top of') edits.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority
member.summary: The priority for an asset load when multiple apply for the same asset.
member.remarks: If multiple non- loads have the same priority, the one registered first will be selected. You can also specify arbitrary intermediate values, like AssetLoadPriority.Low + 5.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority.Low
member.summary: This load is optional and can safely be skipped if there are higher-priority loads.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority.Medium
member.summary: The load is optional and can safely be skipped if there are higher-priority loads, but it should still be preferred over any -priority loads.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority.High
member.summary: The load is optional and can safely be skipped if there are higher-priority loads, but it should still be preferred over any - or -priority loads.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority.Exclusive
member.summary: The load is not optional. If more than one loader has priority, SMAPI will log an error and ignore all of them.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetRequestedEventArgs.LoadFrom(System.Func{System.Object},StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority,System.String)
member.summary: Provide the initial instance for the asset, instead of trying to load it from the game's Content folder.
member.param: Get the initial instance of an asset.
If there are multiple loads that apply to the same asset, the priority with which this one should be applied.
The content pack ID on whose behalf you're applying the change. This is only valid for content packs for your mod.
member.remarks:
Usage notes:
The asset doesn't need to exist in the game's Content folder. If any mod loads the asset, the game will see it as an existing asset as if it was in that folder.
Each asset can logically only have one initial instance. If multiple loads apply at the same time, SMAPI will use the parameter to decide what happens. If you're making changes to the existing asset instead of replacing it, you should use instead to avoid those limitations and improve mod compatibility.
Do not return a cached instance. SMAPI takes ownership of the returned asset and may edit, resize, or dispose it as needed. Returning a cached instance may cause object-disposed errors or cache poisoning (where reloading the asset doesn't undo previously applied edits). If you need a reference to the final edited asset, use the event.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetRequestedEventArgs.LoadFromModFile``1(System.String,StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetLoadPriority)
member.summary: Provide the initial instance for the asset from a file in your mod folder, instead of trying to load it from the game's Content folder.
member.typeparam: The expected data type. The main supported types are , , dictionaries, and lists; other types may be supported by the game's content pipeline.
member.param: The relative path to the file in your mod folder.
If there are multiple loads that apply to the same asset, the priority with which this one should be applied.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetRequestedEventArgs.Edit(System.Action{StardewModdingAPI.IAssetData},StardewModdingAPI.Events.AssetEditPriority,System.String)
member.summary: Edit the asset after it's loaded.
member.param: If there are multiple edits that apply to the same asset, the priority with which this one should be applied.
The content pack ID on whose behalf you're applying the change. This is only valid for content packs for your mod.
member.remarks:
Usage notes:
Editing an asset which doesn't exist has no effect. This is applied after the asset is loaded from the game's Content folder, or from any mod's or .
You can apply any number of edits to the asset. Each edit will be applied on top of the previous one (i.e. it'll see the merged asset from all previous edits as its input).

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.GameLaunchedEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments for an event.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IContentEvents
member.summary: Events related to assets loaded from the content pipeline (including data, maps, and textures).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IContentEvents.AssetRequested
member.summary: Raised when an asset is being requested from the content pipeline.
member.remarks:
The asset isn't necessarily being loaded yet (e.g. the game may be checking if it exists). Mods can register the changes they want to apply using methods on the event arguments. These will be applied when the asset is actually loaded.
If the asset is requested multiple times in the same tick (e.g. once to check if it exists and once to load it), SMAPI might only raise the event once and reuse the cached result.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IContentEvents.AssetsInvalidated
member.summary: Raised after one or more assets were invalidated from the content cache by a mod, so they'll be reloaded next time they're requested. If the assets will be reloaded or propagated automatically, this event is raised before that happens.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IContentEvents.AssetReady
member.summary: Raised after an asset is loaded by the content pipeline, after all mod edits specified via have been applied.
member.remarks: This event is only raised if something requested the asset from the content pipeline. Invalidating an asset from the content cache won't necessarily reload it automatically.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IContentEvents.LocaleChanged
member.summary: Raised after the game language changes.
member.remarks: For non-English players, this may be raised during startup when the game switches to the previously selected language.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents
member.summary: Events related to UI and drawing to the screen.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.MenuChanged
member.summary: Raised after a game menu is opened, closed, or replaced.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderingStep
member.summary: Raised before the game draws a specific step in the rendering cycle.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderedStep
member.summary: Raised after the game draws a specific step in the rendering cycle.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.Rendering
member.summary: Raised before the game draws anything to the screen in a draw tick, as soon as the sprite batch is opened. The sprite batch may be closed and reopened multiple times after this event is called, but it's only raised once per draw tick. This event isn't useful for drawing to the screen, since the game will draw over it.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.Rendered
member.summary: Raised after the game draws to the sprite patch in a draw tick, just before the final sprite batch is rendered to the screen. Since the game may open/close the sprite batch multiple times in a draw tick, the sprite batch may not contain everything being drawn and some things may already be rendered to the screen. Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will be drawn over all vanilla content (including menus, HUD, and cursor).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderingWorld
member.summary: Raised before the game world is drawn to the screen. This event isn't useful for drawing to the screen, since the game will draw over it.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderedWorld
member.summary: Raised after the game world is drawn to the sprite patch, before it's rendered to the screen. Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will be drawn over the world, but under any active menu, HUD elements, or cursor.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderingActiveMenu
member.summary: When a menu is open ( isn't null), raised before that menu is drawn to the screen. This includes the game's internal menus like the title screen. Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will appear under the menu.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderedActiveMenu
member.summary: When a menu is open ( isn't null), raised after that menu is drawn to the sprite batch but before it's rendered to the screen. Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will appear over the menu and menu cursor.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderingHud
member.summary: Raised before drawing the HUD (item toolbar, clock, etc) to the screen. The vanilla HUD may be hidden at this point (e.g. because a menu is open). Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will appear under the HUD.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.RenderedHud
member.summary: Raised after drawing the HUD (item toolbar, clock, etc) to the sprite batch, but before it's rendered to the screen. The vanilla HUD may be hidden at this point (e.g. because a menu is open). Content drawn to the sprite batch at this point will appear over the HUD.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IDisplayEvents.WindowResized
member.summary: Raised after the game window is resized.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents
member.summary: Events linked to the game's update loop. The update loop runs roughly 60 times/second to run game logic like state changes, action handling, etc. These can be useful, but you should consider more semantic events like if possible.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.GameLaunched
member.summary: Raised after the game is launched, right before the first update tick. This happens once per game session (unrelated to loading saves). All mods are loaded and initialized at this point, so this is a good time to set up mod integrations.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.UpdateTicking
member.summary: Raised before the game state is updated (60 times per second).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.UpdateTicked
member.summary: Raised after the game state is updated (60 times per second).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.OneSecondUpdateTicking
member.summary: Raised once per second before the game state is updated.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.OneSecondUpdateTicked
member.summary: Raised once per second after the game state is updated.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.SaveCreating
member.summary: Raised before the game creates a new save file.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.SaveCreated
member.summary: Raised after the game finishes creating the save file.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.Saving
member.summary: Raised before the game begins writing data to the save file (except the initial save creation).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.Saved
member.summary: Raised after the game finishes writing data to the save file (except the initial save creation).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.SaveLoaded
member.summary: Raised after the player loads a save slot and the world is initialized.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.DayStarted
member.summary: Raised after the game begins a new day (including when the player loads a save).

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.DayEnding
member.summary: Raised before the game ends the current day. This happens before it starts setting up the next day and before .

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.TimeChanged
member.summary: Raised after the in-game clock time changes.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.IGameLoopEvents.ReturnedToTitle
member.summary: Raised after the game returns to the title screen.

member.summary: Raised after a player skill level changes. This happens as soon as they level up, not when the game notifies the player after their character goes to bed. NOTE: this event is currently only raised for the current player.

member.summary: Raised after a player warps to a new location. NOTE: this event is currently only raised for the current player.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Events.ISpecializedEvents
member.summary: Events serving specialized edge cases that shouldn't be used by most mods.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.ISpecializedEvents.LoadStageChanged
member.summary: Raised when the low-level stage in the game's loading process has changed. This is an advanced event for mods which need to run code at specific points in the loading process. The available stages or when they happen might change without warning in future versions (e.g. due to changes in the game's load process), so mods using this event are more likely to break or have bugs. Most mods should use instead.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.ISpecializedEvents.UnvalidatedUpdateTicking
member.summary: Raised before the game state is updated (60 times per second), regardless of normal SMAPI validation. This event is not thread-safe and may be invoked while game logic is running asynchronously. Changes to game state in this method may crash the game or corrupt an in-progress save. Do not use this event unless you're fully aware of the context in which your code will be run. Mods using this event will trigger a stability warning in the SMAPI console.

member.name: E:StardewModdingAPI.Events.ISpecializedEvents.UnvalidatedUpdateTicked
member.summary: Raised after the game state is updated (60 times per second), regardless of normal SMAPI validation. This event is not thread-safe and may be invoked while game logic is running asynchronously. Changes to game state in this method may crash the game or corrupt an in-progress save. Do not use this event unless you're fully aware of the context in which your code will be run. Mods using this event will trigger a stability warning in the SMAPI console.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.Rewriters.ReplaceReferencesRewriter
member.summary: Rewrites references to types or type members so they point to a different type or member.

remarks.para: When a type or member was moved/renamed as-is in the game code, you can map it directly using methods like .

Otherwise you can use to create a 'facade' type. This is a type which subclasses the original type (if needed), and provides any number of members with the old signatures which internally call the new members.
Member mappings are only used in cases where the reference to the original member can't be resolved.

To auto-map members to a facade type:
Field: add a public property with the old name and type. Field reads/writes will be auto-mapped to the property's get/set methods, if present. If a get/set method isn't present, that reference will be kept as-is (so you can rewrite only reads or only writes if needed).
Property or Method: add a public property/method with the old name and signature.
Constructor: add a public constructor with the old signature, OR a public static method named 'Constructor' with the old signature which returns an instance of the intended type. The latter avoids returning a facade instance to the calling code, which can cause errors (e.g. when trying to write it to the save file).

When adding a facade for a type with a required constructor, you'll need a constructor on the facade type. This should be private and will never be called (unless you want to rewrite references to the original constructors per the above). You can call in the private constructor to enforce that facades aren't constructed manually.

member.summary: The new types to reference, indexed by the old type's full name.

member.summary: The new members to reference, indexed by the old member's full name.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer
member.summary: Performs heuristic equality checks for instances.
member.remarks: This implementation compares instances to see if they likely refer to the same type. While the implementation is obvious for types like System.Bool, this class mainly exists to handle cases like System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2<!0,Netcode.NetRoot`1<!1>> and System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2<TKey,Netcode.NetRoot`1<TValue>> which are compatible, but not directly comparable. It does this by splitting each type name into its component token types, and performing placeholder substitution (e.g. !0 to TKey in the above example). If all components are equal after substitution, and the tokens can all be mapped to the same generic type, the types are considered equal.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer.Equals(Mono.Cecil.TypeReference,Mono.Cecil.TypeReference)
member.summary: Get whether the specified objects are equal.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer.GetHashCode(Mono.Cecil.TypeReference)
member.summary: Get a hash code for the specified object.
member.param: The object for which a hash code is to be returned.
member.exception: The object type is a reference type and is null.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer.HeuristicallyEquals(Mono.Cecil.TypeReference,Mono.Cecil.TypeReference)
member.summary: Get whether two types are heuristically equal based on generic type token substitution.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer.MapPlaceholder(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Map a generic type placeholder (like !0) to its actual type.
member.param: The map of token to map substitutions.
member.returns: Returns the previously-mapped type if applicable, else the .

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.ModLoading.TypeReferenceComparer.GetTypeSymbols(System.String)
member.summary: Get the top-level type symbols in a type name (e.g. List and NetRef<T> in List<NetRef<T>>)

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.SMultiplayer
member.summary: SMAPI's implementation of the game's core multiplayer logic.
member.remarks:
SMAPI syncs mod context to all players through the host as such: 1. Farmhand sends ModContext + PlayerIntro. 2. If host receives ModContext: it stores the context, replies with known contexts, and forwards it to other farmhands. 3. If host receives PlayerIntro before ModContext: it stores a 'vanilla player' context, and forwards it to other farmhands. 4. If farmhand receives ModContext: it stores it. 5. If farmhand receives ServerIntro without a preceding ModContext: it stores a 'vanilla host' context. 6. If farmhand receives PlayerIntro without a preceding ModContext AND it's not the host peer: it stores a 'vanilla player' context.
Once a farmhand/server stored a context, messages can be sent to that player through the SMAPI APIs.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.SMultiplayer.BroadcastModMessage``1(``0,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.Int64[])
member.summary: Broadcast a mod message to matching players.
member.param: The data to send over the network.

A message type which receiving mods can use to decide whether it's the one they want to handle, like SetPlayerLocation. This doesn't need to be globally unique, since mods should check the originating mod ID.
The unique ID of the mod sending the message.
The mod IDs which should receive the message on the destination computers, or null for all mods. Specifying mod IDs is recommended to improve performance, unless it's a general-purpose broadcast.
The values for the players who should receive the message, or null for all players. If you don't need to broadcast to all players, specifying player IDs is recommended to reduce latency.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.Utilities.IntervalMemoryCache`2
member.summary: A memory cache with sliding expiry based on custom intervals, with no background processing.
member.remarks: This is optimized for small caches that are reset relatively rarely. Each cache entry is marked as hot (accessed since the interval started) or stale. When a new interval is started, stale entries are cleared and hot entries become stale.

member.summary: The cached values that were accessed during the current interval.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.Framework.Utilities.IntervalMemoryCache`2.StaleCache
member.summary: The cached values that will expire on the next interval.

member.summary: Get a value from the cache, fetching it first if needed.
member.param: The unique key for the cached value.
Get the latest data if it's not in the cache yet.

member.summary: Start a new cache interval, removing any stale entries.

member.summary: Copy layers, tiles, and tilesheets from another map onto the asset.
member.param: The map from which to copy.
The tile area within the source map to copy, or null for the entire source map size. This must be within the bounds of the map.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.IAssetName.StartsWith(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get whether the asset name starts with the given value, ignoring capitalization and formatting. This can be used with a trailing slash to test for an asset folder, like Data/.
member.param: Whether to match if the prefix occurs mid-word, so Data/AchievementsToIgnore matches prefix Data/Achievements. If this is false, the prefix only matches if the asset name starts with the prefix followed by a non-alphanumeric character (including ., /, or \\) or the end of string.

Whether to match the prefix if there's a subfolder path after it, so Data/Achievements/Example matches prefix Data/Achievements. If this is false, the prefix only matches if the asset name has no / or \\ characters after the prefix.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.IAssetName.IsDirectlyUnderPath(System.String)
member.summary: Get whether the asset is directly within the given asset path.
member.remarks: For example, Characters/Dialogue/Abigail is directly under Characters/Dialogue but not Characters or Characters/Dialogue/Ab. To allow sub-paths, use instead.
member.param: The asset path to check. This doesn't need a trailing slash.

member.summary: Remove an asset from the content cache so it's reloaded on the next request. This will reload core game assets if needed, but references to the former asset will still show the previous content.

member.param: The asset key to invalidate in the content folder.
member.exception: The is empty or contains invalid characters.
member.returns: Returns whether the given asset key was cached.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.IGameContentHelper.InvalidateCache``1
member.summary: Remove all assets of the given type from the cache so they're reloaded on the next request. This can be a very expensive operation and should only be used in very specific cases. This will reload core game assets if needed, but references to the former assets will still show the previous content.
member.typeparam: The asset type to remove from the cache.
member.returns: Returns whether any assets were invalidated.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.IGameContentHelper.InvalidateCache(System.Func{StardewModdingAPI.IAssetInfo,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Remove matching assets from the content cache so they're reloaded on the next request. This will reload core game assets if needed, but references to the former asset will still show the previous content.
member.param: A predicate matching the assets to invalidate.
member.returns: Returns whether any cache entries were invalidated.

member.summary: Get an API that other mods can access. This is always called after , and is called once per mod that accesses the API (even if they access it multiple times).
member.remarks: Returns the API instance, or null if the mod has no API. Note that is provided for informational purposes only, and that denying API access to specific mods is strongly discouraged and may be considered abusive.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.IMultiplayerHelper.SendMessage``1(``0,System.String,System.String[],System.Int64[])
member.summary: Send a message to mods installed by connected players.
member.typeparam: The data type. This can be a class with a default constructor, or a value type.
member.param: The data to send over the network.

A message type which receiving mods can use to decide whether it's the one they want to handle, like SetPlayerLocation. This doesn't need to be globally unique, since mods should check the originating mod ID.
The mod IDs which should receive the message on the destination computers, or null for all mods. Specifying mod IDs is recommended to improve performance, unless it's a general-purpose broadcast.
The values for the players who should receive the message, or null for all players. If you don't need to broadcast to all players, specifying player IDs is recommended to reduce latency.
member.exception: The or is null.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper
member.summary: Provides translations stored in the mod's i18n folder, with one file per locale (like en.json) containing a flat key => value structure. Translations are fetched with locale fallback, so missing translations are filled in from broader locales (like pt-BR.json < pt.json < default.json).

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.Locale
member.summary: The current locale code like fr-FR, or an empty string for English.

member.name: P:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.LocaleEnum
member.summary: The game's current language code.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.GetTranslations
member.summary: Get all translations for the current locale.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Get a translation for the current locale.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.Get(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Get a translation for the current locale.
member.param: An object containing token key/value pairs. This can be an anonymous object (like new { value = 42, name = "Cranberries" }), a dictionary, or a class instance.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.ITranslationHelper.GetInAllLocales(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a translation in every locale for which it's defined.
member.param: Whether to add duplicate translations for locale fallback. For example, if a translation is defined in default.json but not fr.json, setting this to true will add a fr entry which duplicates the default text.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel
member.summary: The log severity levels.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Trace
member.summary: Tracing info intended for developers.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Troubleshooting info that may be relevant to the player.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: Info relevant to the player. This should be used judiciously.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Warn
member.summary: An issue the player should be aware of. This should be used rarely.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: A message indicating something went wrong.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.LogLevel.Alert
member.summary: Important information to highlight for the player when player action is needed (e.g. new version available). This should be used rarely to avoid alert fatigue.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMapMode
member.summary: Indicates how a map should be patched.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMapMode.Overlay
member.summary: Replace matching tiles. Target tiles missing in the source area are kept as-is.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMapMode.ReplaceByLayer
member.summary: Replace all tiles on layers that exist in the source map.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMapMode.Replace
member.summary: Replace all tiles with the source map.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMode
member.summary: Indicates how an image should be patched.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMode.Replace
member.summary: Erase the original content within the area before drawing the new content.

member.name: F:StardewModdingAPI.PatchMode.Overlay
member.summary: Draw the new content over the original content, so the original content shows through any transparent or semi-transparent pixels.

member.summary: The assembly paths in the search folders indexed by assembly name.

member.summary: The main entry point which hooks into and launches the game.

member.summary: Method called when assembly resolution fails, which may return a manually resolved assembly.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.AssertGamePresent
member.summary: Assert that the game is available.
member.remarks: This must be checked *before* any references to , and this method should not reference itself to avoid errors in Mono or when the game isn't present.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.AssertGameVersion
member.summary: Assert that the game version is within and .

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.AssertSmapiVersions
member.summary: Assert that the versions of all SMAPI components are correct.
member.remarks: Players sometimes have mismatched versions (particularly when installed through Vortex), which can cause some very confusing bugs without this check.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.AssertDepsJson
member.summary: Assert that SMAPI's StardewModdingAPI.deps.json matches Stardew Valley.deps.json, fixing it if necessary.
member.remarks: This is needed to resolve native DLLs like libSkiaSharp.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.Start(System.String[])
member.summary: Initialize SMAPI and launch the game.
member.remarks: This method is separate from because that can't contain any references to assemblies loaded by (e.g. via ), or Mono will incorrectly show an assembly resolution error before assembly resolution is set up.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.PrintErrorAndExit(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Write an error directly to the console and exit.
member.param: An additional message to log with technical details.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Program.PressAnyKeyToExit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show a 'press any key to exit' message, and exit when they press a key.
member.param: Whether to print a 'press any key to exit' message to the console.

member.summary: The placeholder text when the translation is null or empty, where {0} is the translation key.

member.summary: The locale for which the translation was fetched like fr-FR, or an empty string for English.

member.summary: The underlying translation text.

member.summary: The value to return if the translations is undefined.

member.summary: The original translation key.

member.summary: Construct an instance.
member.param: The locale for which the translation was fetched.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.Default(System.String)
member.summary: Replace the text if it's null or empty. If you set a null or empty value, the translation will show the fallback "no translation" placeholder (see if you want to disable that). Returns a new instance if changed.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.UsePlaceholder(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to return a "no translation" placeholder if the translation is null or empty. Returns a new instance.
member.param: Whether to return a placeholder. Due to limitations with nullable reference types, setting this to false will still mark the text non-nullable.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.Tokens(System.Object)
member.summary: Replace tokens in the text like {{value}} with the given values. Returns a new instance.
member.param: An object containing token key/value pairs. This can be an anonymous object (like new { value = 42, name = "Cranberries" }), a dictionary, or a class instance.
member.exception: The argument is null.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.HasValue
member.summary: Get whether the translation has a defined value.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.ToString
member.summary: Get the translation text. Calling this method isn't strictly necessary, since you can assign a value directly to a string.

remarks.strong: Limitation with nullable reference types: if there's no text and you disabled the fallback via , this will return null but the return value will still be marked non-nullable.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Translation.op_Implicit(StardewModdingAPI.Translation)~System.String
member.summary: Get a string representation of the given translation.

remarks.strong: Limitation with nullable reference types: if there's no text and you disabled the fallback via , this will return null but the return value will still be marked non-nullable.

member.summary: Construct an instance.

member.name: T:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.DelegatingModHooks
member.summary: An implementation of which automatically calls the parent instance for any method that's not overridden.
member.remarks: The mod hooks are primarily meant for SMAPI to use. Using this directly in mods is a last resort, since it's very easy to break SMAPI this way. This class requires that SMAPI is present in the parent chain.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.KeybindList.GetState
member.summary: Get the overall keybind list state relative to the previous tick.
member.remarks: States are transitive across keybind. For example, if one keybind is 'released' and another is 'pressed', the state of the keybind list is 'held'.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.KeybindList.IsDown
member.summary: Get whether any of the button sets are pressed.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.KeybindList.JustPressed
member.summary: Get whether the input binding was just pressed this tick.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.KeybindList.GetKeybindCurrentlyDown
member.summary: Get the keybind which is currently down, if any. If there are multiple keybinds down, the first one is returned.

member.name: M:StardewModdingAPI.Utilities.KeybindList.ToString
member.summary: Get a string representation of the input binding.
member.remarks: A keybind list is serialized to a string like LeftControl + S, LeftAlt + S, where each multi-key binding is separated with , and the keys within each keybind are separated with +. The key order is commutative, so LeftControl + S and S + LeftControl are identical.
